title: GoldieLocks Bear Safe EP
description:
Bear Safe EP  -  GoldieLocks

01 - Smash Grab
02 - Dolla Dolla
03 - Wrapped
04 - Havin 'er Up
05 - Provider (GoldieLocks Refix)
06 - Muthafuckaa!



Sarah Louise Akwisombe[1](born 17 June 1985 in Croydon, England) is an English female rapper, singer and producer better known by her stage name of GoldieLocks.

AkwisombeÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½s rap career began accidentally when she was assigned a music project while she was in college. She then uploaded her recorded material onto her MySpace and was surprised when she received positive feedback from people that had listened to her music.
Akwisombe records and produces her music using Logic Studio and Microkorg, which are two kinds of music software on her Mac laptop to make beats and sounds and a microphone to record her voice.[2] Since then, she has released songs on her MySpace, the most notable being "Waste Man", a song about a man who cheated on her sister. She has stated she doesnÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½t exactly know what style her music is, but has said her music is "a bit of electro, a bit of grime, a bit of garage, a bit of pop and a bit of hip hop."[3]
Although Akwisombe worked part-time at Starbucks to help support her career, she has signed with Locked On Records and is working on an album with Future Cut, who has notably contributed to Lily Allen's album, Alright, Still. She has also collaborated with Frisco, Example, Kate Nash, The Mitchell Brothers and Tinchy Stryder respectively.[4] She did a remix for Mutya Buena's single, "Just a Little Bit".[5] She is a member of The Sick Kids, a grime and electro female rap group consisting of herself, JacksonKiD!, and lele [SPEAKS].
